4.5. gpl

class nettoolkit.gpl.Container

Bases: abc.ABC

Abstract base class providing template for standard dunder methods template. Object should contain objVar property

abstract property objVar

static read_excel(file, sheet='Sheet1', **kwargs)

reads a sheet from an excel —>returns dataframe of that sheet data

Parameters

  • sheet – sheet name on source excel which is to be read.

  • kwargs (mutli) – pandas df arguments to read excel

class nettoolkit.gpl.DifferenceDict(d)

Bases: dict

Template class to get difference in two dictionary objects. use dunder +/- for adds/removes.

additive = '+ '
get_change(d, change)

compare current object/dict with provided new object/dict (ie: d) and return differences based on change required (“- “/”+ “)

missing = '- '

class nettoolkit.gpl.Multi_Execution(items=None)

Bases: nettoolkit.gpl.Default

Template methods for multi-threaded executions. [self.items items are eligible threaded candidates]

end()

Closure process

abstract classmethod execute(hn)

abstract class method, to be executed for each item in self.items

execute_mt()

threaded execution in groups (self.max_connections defines max threaded processes)

execute_sequencial()

sequencial execution of items

execute_steps(multi_thread=True)

steps defining executions

execute_threads_max(item_list)

threaded execution of a group

get_devices()

get devices names from list of files

max_connections = 30
start(multi_thread=True)

starting up executins either threaded/sequencial

Deletes trailing remarks from Juniper config line/string –>str :param s: number of characters from right :type s: str

static ending(line, c)

check if line ends with c or not, same as native string.endswith() addition is it first strips the line and then checks –>boolean

static find_all(s, sub, start=0, count=None, beginwith=False)

search for multiple substrings ‘sub’ within string ‘s’ usage: find_all(s, sub, [start=n, [count=c]]) –> (all matches) -> bool

Parameters

  • s (str) – main string

  • sub ((str, tuple, list)) – sub string ( to be search within main string )

  • start (int) – Optional: substring to be start search from index (def:0)

  • count (int) – Optional: count of character from start index (def:end)

static find_any(s, sub, start=0, count=None, beginwith=False)

search for multiple substrings ‘sub’ within string ‘s’ usage: find_any(s, sub, [start=n, [count=c]]) –> (any matches) -> bool

Parameters

  • s (str) – main string

  • sub ((str, tuple, list)) – sub string ( to be search within main string )

  • start (int) – Optional: substring to be start search from index (def:0)

  • count (int) – Optional: count of character from start index (def:end)

static find_multi(s, sub, start=0, count=None, index=True, beginwith=False)

search for multiple substrings ‘sub’ within string ‘s’ usage: find_multi(s, sub, [start=n, [count=c], index=True]) –> list of indexes/bool

Parameters

  • s (str) – main string

  • sub ((str, tuple, list)) – sub string ( to be search within main string )

  • start (int) – Optional: substring to be start search from index (def:0)

  • count (int) – Optional: count of character from start index (def:end)

  • index (bool) – Optional: return index or boolean values(def:True=Index)

static find_within(s, prefix, suffix=None, pos=0)

finds characters between prefix and suffix substrings from string, –> tuple: (str, int)

Parameters

  • s (str) – main string to be search within

  • prefix (str) – starting substring

  • suffix (str) – ending substring

  • pos (int) – position index, search to be start from

index-0 is returned string index-1 is position of returned suffix position

Parameters

  • duo (str) – characters which requires reductions if susequent

  • strip (int) – values (-1=lstrip ,0=strip ,1=rstrip) - def:None

static get_logfile_name(folder, hn, cmd='', ts='', separator='_@_', extn='.log')

return log file name for the command on device with/wo provided time_stamp. folder = path to where file should be saved hn = file name starting with provided host-name cmd = file name containing additional commands string ts = file name containing additional time stamp separator = hn-cmd-ts separator extn = extension of filename –> str (filename along with full path)

class nettoolkit.gpl.XL_READ(xl, shtName='Sheet1')

Bases: object

EXCEL FILE READING, xl - Excel file to be read shtName - SheetName to be read from given read

df - DataFrame object (iterable, lenth, etc. available )

obj = XL_READ(‘data/cmd_list.xlsx’) # get xl df Object

### Length of records ### print(len(obj))

### Go thru each record ### for header, value in obj:

print(header, value)

### Get a particular column ### print(obj[“command”])

### FILTERING RECORDS ### # Option:1 flt = {‘level’:1, ‘dev_type’:’cisco_ios’} # get arguments in a dict x = obj.filter(**flt) # apply filter dict

# Option:2 x = obj.filter(dev_type=’cisco_ios’, level=1)# apply filter manually

# Option:3 - pass external df for filter x = obj.filter(level=1) # created a new DataFrame-x x = obj.filter(df=x, dev_type=’cisco_ios’)# apply flt manually on new DF-x

# Option:4 Filter Column & return specific columns only. flt = {‘level’:1, ‘dev_type’:’cisco_ios’} # get arguments in a dict col = [‘command’, ‘level’] x = obj.column_values(column=col, **flt)

# Check Output for above options print(x) # filtered output all columns print(x[‘xl_col’]) # filtered output with specific col only

column_values(column, **kwarg)

selected column output, after filters applied column - a single column name or , list of column names kwarg - filters to be applied

filter(df=None, **kwarg)

Filter Records df - external data frame ( default object dataframe ) kwarg - filters to be applied on df.

class nettoolkit.gpl.XL_WRITE(hostname, folder, index=False, **sht_df)

Bases: object

EXEL FILE CREATE, hostname - excel file name **sht_df - sht_name=dataframe

df - dataframe which data to be copied to Excel. sht_name - Sheet Name of Excel where data to be copied

Excel O/P file will go inside - ./output/ - path

nettoolkit.gpl.dict_differences(d1, d2, change)

returns differences for provided two dictionaries input d1, d2 type: string/int/float/set/dictionary input change is change type prefix (ex: ” -“, ” +”) return value type depends on input d1, d2 type.

nettoolkit.gpl.nslookup(ip)

return discovered hostname for provided ip –>int
